intro: Meristostigma junceum, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a small evergreen herbaceous plant belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing structure with whorled leaves that are often narrow and linear. The plant produces small, cone-like structures called strobili, which contain the reproductive organs. Meristostigma junceum thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its unique botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on ancient plant lineages and ecological adaptations.
